< review>
Came in for a late lunch and it was still pretty busy. The kitchen had a glass window so you can see them grill & prepare your food. We got the yogurt dip with pita bread. I had them order for me since they wanted me to try other things. I ended up with a lamb kabob (1/2 kabob with rice & grilled veggies)... so tender, juicy, & melts in your mouth good. I never really thought I'd enjoy lamb but this was really good. I also tried their lamb chops & their combination plate. All really good. An order is plenty to split between two people.< /review>
<Name>Jennifer Johnson< /Name>< rate>
4</rate>

< text>
Ate at this place twice while while visiting family in Burlingame- it‚Äôs so good we came back for seconds! It‚Äôs set back off the road with a big parking lot out front, so it can be hard to find. The exterior is very unassuming, but don‚Äôt judge a book by its cover; this place has excellent food and great staff! They also got our food out to us really quick. Definitely give this place a try if you‚Äôre in the area.< /text>

Johnny Nguyen< /name>
<date>1578104636837< /date>< Rating>
4< /Rating>
< review>
Horchata and two tacos were about $8.7.  I've never had burria before but it's some sort of meat stew so having it in a taco was cool! Both lengua and burria tacos were a tad overseasoned but came out with a piping, hot, and generous portion of meat.  The horchata was creamy and sweet, almost like drinking cocoa puff cereal milk with a hint of cinnamon.  Meal comes with a small tray of tortilla chips.

Would come back if near the area.< /review>

< Text>
Very tasty burrito.  Service was quick and friendly and the prices were very reasonable.  I'll certainly be back the next time I'm in town.  The place needs a big sign on the building and on the street.  If I wasn't searching for "Mexican food" on google maps while staying at the hotel across the street, there is no way I would have found it.  Even while standing in the parking lot, I wasn't sure I was in the right spot.   Glad I found it!</Text>

<date>1503758092983< /date><Rate>5</Rate><Text>Best Sea Food in the Antelope Valley! Fresh, very authenticc tasting from the Ceviche, rice and beans, to the Mojarra and, bacon wrapped shrimp and cocktails, the isnt a Mexican Restaurant that can too Mariscos Costa Mar out here. <rating>5< /rating><Text>If you are a native San Franciscan, you have a love/hate relationship with this place. You have the mecca of great dance music, eccentric individuals, drunks and music lovers. I personally love the End Up, although the lines have been pretty ridiculous since it is the only after 2am spot where you can boogie if you aren't ready to go home. They have done extensive upgrades to their couches, back room area, patio area and upper small patio area. I have always enjoyed having a cocktail in their garden and just listen to great music. Their sound system is also perfect for the size of the venue and I have never danced harder at any other venue in the city. This place is made to sweat. <Text>You have to be in the right state of mind for the end up...  They don't call it the end up for nothin!  If you are still awake at 4am and you aren't ready for the party to stop you just might "End Up" here.   Of course they is no liquor severed after 2am so if you don't wanna be sober I'm sure you could find other treats at this place as most sidewalk pharmacist end up here too.  I'm not sure what time the end up closes but its long after I'm passed out at home for sure.  Last time we ended up here we didn't leave until sometime after 7am.

They have an unexpected patio out back with plenty of seating I thought there was even someone selling hot dogs or something last time (but I may have just dreamed that lol)
There is also at least one pool table...  Its all a little hazy...

But if you are looking for the after party it is always at the end up.  So if you want to keep party rockin head to the End Up and pound Reb Bull all night.</Text>< Rate>

<Gmap_id>0x80db033320098f47:0x2c24ba998af50df2</Gmap_id><text>As the owner of a high-end vacation rental company, I shop at Misty's four to five times a month.  Misty has a keen design sense and is very selective about what she accepts into consignment.  Consequently, you won't find "garage sale" pieces or prices.  What you will find is high quality furniture, accessories and artwork, tastefully displayed and priced to sell.  Misty and her team of friendly, knowledgeable assistants will go out of their way to help you find something special without being pushy.  TIP:  If you find that perfect piece (and you probably will), BUY IT! .... because it most likely won't be there tomorrow.</text>< Name>

<Text>Misty's Consignments on Hiway 111 in the greater Palm Springs area is a very large furniture and home furnishings seller. Expect very diverse and fully stocked showrooms of what appears to be high quality second hand goods. The prices will be lower than new furniture/furnishings prices, but don't expect cheap prices. I'd call them moderate pricing on the newly consigned peices, with a price reduction program as the goods age. It's worth a visit, you might just find something reasonably priced that you must have.</Text></record></dataset><record>

< Text>
Misty's offers a vast selection of furnishings that range in prices and decades. I've never seen such a huge selection of patio furniture as well as vintage funishings/art/collectables at any other consignment store in the valley. Just when you think you've finished....there's another room! There's also an onsite jewelry consignment area. The pricing is very reasonable here, a percentage is taken off the longer the item sits....but nothing ever gathers dust in this place. The staff is super friendly, knowledgeable and not pushy. Don't pay retail - go to Mistys!<//Text>

< Text>
I got my little sisters piercing done here and all was fine. Well a few days after, the piercing ended up inside her nose? I have my own piercing and when I did it, nothing like this happened. We did some googling and turns out if the piercer didn‚Äôt do it right, this happens. I wouldn‚Äôt trust the piercer again. On the upside, they were very nice. But the piercing is literally inside her nose.

Update: went to another piercer and had gotten it fixed. Thankfully, nothing got infected.</Text>
< Pics>
None</Pics>
<Response>{'time': 1562025538863, 'text': 'Hi Kameryn. Thank you for bringing your sister in. It‚Äôs not common place to get a third party review so please read this response to your sister. It is unfortunate that this happened to your sister‚Äôs piercing but this review is a bit of a fallacy. Swelling. Swelling is what can, on occasion, cause something like this to happen. Information of this happening is also available on Google. It is difficult to anticipate how much someone is going to swell. The jewelry is provided with adequate length to allow for some swelling to happen. At times, some swelling happens above the average rate. Generally when this happens, the client contacts the shop or the piercer directly, rather than google, to address this issue. Had your sister done this, this matter could have been very easily addressed and remedied. All of our contact information is available on Google. In the future, please, before a review like this, contact the one who provided the service so you, or who you‚Äôre representing, can get the appropriate feedback and alleviate whatever the complaint might be. Incorrect information in a review such as this can also negatively impact others not in any way involved in the situation.'}< /Response>< Gmap_id>

<rating>1< /rating>< review>
my sisters and i went to this tattoo shop last friday, to get ear piercings. both my sisters and i ended up having horrible experiences. the piercer that we had (a lady with a bad attitude) right off the bat was very rude and you could tell she didn‚Äôt want to be there anymore. my sister and i got our cartilage pierced and our tragus pierced, and for the tragus, the piercer put in the wrong jewelry. she was supposed to put in a curved bar, and instead input a straight bar, that was meant for the lip. on top of that she didn‚Äôt not tighten the ball at all and it ended up falling out today. the piercer was supposed to have us lie down on the chair while piercing our tragus and she had us sitting up the whole time, and did not even tell us how to care for our piercings when we left. today when my ball fell out, i decided to go to another tattoo shop to get it fixed, and i decided to go to good neighbor tattoo in san marcos, and thank god i did. Anisa was my piercer here and she was literally the best. she immediately told me everything wrong with the piercing i had gotten and she gave me my options on how to fix it. she ended up putting a curved earring in my tragus, and helped me to clean up the infection i had a little bit. i highly recommend going to her to get any piercing because she was amazing. it literally did not hurt nearly as bad as it did when i initially got it pierced. she made everything clear that she was doing and you could tell she loved her job and cares about her clients. before going to dermal grafix, please consider going to good neighbor tattoo first. you won‚Äôt regret it.< /review>

We at DermalGrafix strive to ensure our clients have a great experience at the shop. Our Friday 13th events can be a very high volume day for us as I‚Äôm sure you can recall. Our piercer remembers you both and recalls the experience quite differently. She did mention to you that the day has been busy and due to a previous injury she had some back pain. We regret if this had made you feel as if you didn‚Äôt receive the proper attention you felt was due.\nIn regards to the information you‚Äôve received from Anissa, it is just incorrect and subjective from piercer to piercer. I know her personally and she‚Äôs great at what she does, but has left you misinformed about this piercing process. There is just not a single type of jewelry to be used nor a single mandatory position in which one should be in getting that piercing. If you‚Äôd like, please do a brief google/YouTube search for that piercing and you‚Äôll see.\nI do hope that in the future, before leaving another review like this, you might consider that some information is subjective. We would greatly appreciate you removing this review in light of what I‚Äôve shared with you in this response. If not, I hope that you might have other considerations before another review. < Review>
Camry at the front desk is a delight, and happens to love our dog which makes it so fun. Kim is always helpful and kind too, even though they‚Äôre both quite busy. The prices are fair as well, which is a huge benefit, and they take Care Credit. We recommend APH to everyone we know. *** Update *** I did take one of my puppies here at 5 weeks, since she always struggled to grow and had some obvious health issues. I ended up seeing the older vet; I think his name is Dr. Jacobs. He didn't really give her much of an exam and just said she was 'genetically weak' and would always be sick. He took her temp rectally and pushed it in about 2" into a 6" long teeny pug puppy. She cried out and continued to, as he bent the thermometer around to read it while it was still too far inside her. :( When it came out it was bloody, and he brushed off my shock, saying "They don't make those things for babies!" I don't like to give them this report, because I do like the front staff a lot, and Dr. Sandhu has been good to us, but I'd hate for anyone else to have that experience. So, if you go, see Dr. Sandhu. There can also be pretty long wait times - up to an hour.</Review>

<Time>1526677608227</Time><Rating>1<//Rating><review>The worst customer service experience I have ever had. In any field. I coordinated customer service seminars for years and I would be happy to give some MUCH NEEDED advice:
1 - don't hang up on callers
2 - say, "do you have an emergency, or can I place you on a brief hold" before you rudely cut the potential customer off and put them on hold
3 - subscribe to a hold recording service rather than have someone listen to dead air for a few minutes.
4 - don't cut off a person mid-sentence (that is basic proper social etiquette)
5 - take notes if you have a problem with concentration and information retention so the caller is not having to repeat themselves
6 - smile when you speak. It reflects through your tone of voice

Your front office staff is the first contact a potential client has with your clinic.  Invest in the best team possible.</review><Pics>None< /Pics><Response>None< /Response>< GmapID>

<rate>2</rate><Review>Recently I went to American Pet Hospital because my dog had an eye infection. I usually go to my normal vet but it is a bit of a drive and being that this clinic was close I thought I would try it out. Upon coming into the clinic I noticed that the front desk woman was constantly leaving her desk to use the bathroom so a woman who I am assuming is a vet tech at the clinic had to step in to help us out. She had us fill out paperwork and almost right away called us into a room to wait for the vet. Which seemed good at the time only we sat in that room for close to 30 minutes waiting to be seen in a clinic that was no where close to busy. So after bringing this to the front desks attention they responded" wow you havent been seen yet?! I wonder what the hold up is? You guys have been in there forever." Immediately after we said something the vet came in. He took one look at our dogs eye and took a guess that he had a fox tail stuck in it. He wanted to put him under local anesthesia and put a needle into his eye to probe around and see if there was a foxtail stuck in it. He went on to say that this would cost maybe a few hundred dollars! I was shocked, I have been around animals all my life and I know the first thing a vet will usually do is examine the dog and then put a colored liquid in their eye to see if there is a scratch first before suggesting anything more serious. I asked him why would he suggest something so evasive when he only took one look at his eye? He said that he just wouldnt know what the cause of problem was until he got a good look around in his eye. I was horrified. We waited for 30 minutes only to have a vet look at our dog for 50 seconds and then talk to us for 1 minute about probing into our poor dogs eye while he was only under local anesthesia for hundreds of dollars!!! So I decided to leave, I wasnt going to put my dog through this when I was sure it was just a simple infection or a scratch. While waiting to pay my 28 dollar "visit fee" which should have been waived since the vet spent a whole 2 minutes with us,the front desk woman talked to a man about his cats  when she could see we were ready to pay and leave. So after waiting for a long time we decided to walk out after that horrible experience and only when we walked out did a vet tech run after us saying that we didnt pay. We gave her the money and when we told her what the vet had said she just said "oh yeah yeah..." as if that was a typical thing for him to rush to do an extreme surgery before checking anything out before. So we left extremely upset with this awful visit.The next day we took our dog to our normal vet where we found out he just had a scratch on his eyeball, we will have to apply ointment on his eye for it to heal, they found this scratch without using any needles or putting our dog in any pain like the vet at American Pet Hospital suggested. I apologize for this post being so long but I am simply appauled that there is a vet out there performing or suggesting to perform services like this on innocent animals who may just have a simple problem like a scratch on his eye like my dog did. In my opinion this vet just wants to make money by charging his clients for unncessary procedures. So if you care about your animals please do not take them to this clinic. The vet visits may cost a little more else where but your animals deserve better care than what this place offers. Worst vet visit I have ever been to, from the front desk to that vet, they should all be ashamed of how they run that clinic.<//Review>< Date>
1367687872957</Date>

<Review>Back in 2010, I was 19 years old and broke my two front teeth almost in half. I was devastated. My smile had always been one of my favorite traits and I was utterly terrified that I needed crowns.

Dr. Ian Leopold was patient and empathetic throughout the entire process. He understood my anxiety and assured me that the final results would be great. Dr. Ian Leopold completed each step with exceptional skill, including creating temporary caps and administering numbing shots (nothing like watching a needle go into your gums). He ensured that that the final fit was perfect and that my teeth looked natural.

What prompted me to write this post, is that even ten years later‚Äîmy crowns still are perfect. No chipping, discoloration, or irritation. My teeth look completely natural and no one knows that I have crowns unless I tell them. I have gone to numerous dentists over the years and even they don‚Äôt know that I have crowns until they see an x-ray or do an exam. I purposely don‚Äôt tell dentists beforehand, just to see their reaction as they exclaim at the skill that took to complete such excellent teeth. If you need crowns, I highly HIGHLY recommend going to SLO Smiles!<//Review>< rate>

< review>
I can not say enough good things about Dr Ian Leopold and every person I have come in contact with in his office. I am that person that has struggled with a lot of anxiety about going to the dentist since I was a child. A couple years ago when my daughter chipped her tooth I called around looking to get her in right away to get it fixed. Hands down SLO Smiles was the friendliest and easiest to work with. After meeting Ian and watching him work on my daughter I was so impressed. After years of not going because of my fears, I thought I would give it a try.  From the girls at the front desk to the hygienist ( Robyn/Michelle) to the clinical team ( Gena) and of course Ian, everyone made me feel so at ease. I also must say the work my daughter and myself have had done has been flawless and quality work. Not to mention painless. I never thought I would be able to overcome my fears about the dentist, I am truly grateful to SLO Smiles for making this happen for me. For anyone who is thinking its been to long and they should give it a try I highly recommend going to SLO Smiles. <Review>I was previously treated by a local dentist who, in my opinion did extensive dental work on me (I had 4 root canals finished by this dentist and went there for a total of about 2.5 years). After two of the teeth repairs failed (one within a few months and the other just 1.5 years later) I was concerned. When the second tooth failed he didn't even provide all of the options to me, I had to ask about an implant. His plan was to pull the tooth that day and make a bridge. After pushing for an implant, he sent me to an oral surgeon and stated it could possibly all be done in one day. The appointment was scheduled for one week from then. My boss heard about this and recommended Dr. Ian Leopold and I was squeezed in two days later for a consult. He took the time to explain everything to me and reasoning  behind each step. I am in the last phase of an implant and have had nothing but good experiences along the way. I then had a second opinion/consult with him about my other teeth and he found some things that  were not even told to me from the previous dentist who I had just saw two months earlier. I will never go anywhere else for dental care and have complete trust in Dr. Ian Leopold. I do not think he just does things to make money but does what he thinks is the best decision and will discuss options with you every step of the way. His assistants and the staff are just as great always being accommodating and keeping tabs on things for me. I highly recommend this office.< /Review><pics>None</pics>< response>

<user_id>112922458599552631127</user_id><user_name>Dawn` Mazur</user_name><Time>1534694847756< /Time><Rating>5</Rating><Review>My best friend recommended SLO smiles to me. The first one was a cavity below the gum line in the last molar, which is a very difficult place to anesthetize.  Dr. Maine allowed about 1/2 hour for this area to become numb, something other dentists in the past have not allowed.  The procedure was not only pain free, but I felt total relaxation the whole time.  My second problem seemed hopeless to me, and I had been to other dentists who had not been able to solve the issue... I had a severe accident 45 years ago which left me without front teeth... followed by a number of dental procedures which resulted in scar tissue and a tiny gap between the remaining teeth that was too small for a denture to fit.  I had been living without any front teeth and smiling very carefully, with my lips only, so no one would be aware that I was toothless for a number of years.  Dr. Maine worked with the lab and a creative solution was hatched to give me the look of normal front teeth in a removable denture.  Other dentists had tried and failed to resolve my issue.  The solution surpassed my wildest expectations!  For the first time in 7 years I can now smile... and even my closest family members did not even realize my new denture was not my own teeth. <date>1464453401203</date><rate>5< /rate>< review>
I have been going to Leopold Murphy and Main since 2007...ever since I was referred to them by another local dental practitioner and several friends. I was in need of restorative/cosmetic work due to a long family history of poor dental health. I was in my 50s.  I was directed to see Dr. Mark Leopold. He and his work are awesome!  He is a perfectionist and a very caring practitioner. After he semi-retired and became a specialist I switched over to his son Ian. Ian is every bit as focused on quality and kindness as his Dad. I actually enjoy dental visits (I feared them as a kid)...and it is because of this practice and staff...they are all long term employees and everyone has a GREAT attitude. They work as a team and strive for excellence. I have been to several dental practices on the Central Coast and I truly believe this is the best of the best!</review>

<Review>I recently relocated to SLO County and was pretty nervous about finding a new dentist. I left a great one behind when I moved, and had also begun the process of getting dental implants (after a bridge broke two months before our relocation - worst timing ever!) After stopping by several different dental offices in SLO, Templeton and Atascadero, I still hadn't found one that felt right -- until I walked into SLO Smiles. To be honest, I'd been put off by the cutesy name, but there is nothing frivolous about this practice. They spent plenty of time showing me around, introducing staff, and answering all my questions about the practice, the dentists' education and expertise, and the cost of the procedures required to complete my dental repairs. Since then I've had a comprehensive exam with Dr. Ian Loepold, who impressed me with his confident perfectionism, thoroughness, and the state-of-the-art equipment in his arsenal. I also had a first cleaning with Lissa, and she couldn't have been more gentle or more thorough. < Text>
Dr. Ian Leopold is awesome!  He is super friendly and extremely skilled and knowledgable!  I had a natural defect in my front tooth that was deep and stained and he fixed perfectly in under 15 minutes!  I literally can't even tell where the defect used to be--he filled and matched the filling material so perfectly!  He was very thorough and took the time to explain my x-rays to me and answer any questions I had.  He wasn't too aggressive with recommending treatment but made sure to note all my potential problem areas and potential cavities.  I will go back to him for all of my dental work and I recommend him to all my family and friends.  You literally won't meet a more competent or friendly dentist in SLO!  Also, their office is incredibly beautiful and comfortable--unlike any dental office I have ever been too!  If you want a great dentist go to Dr. Ian Leopold!<//Text>

< review>
I've been going to Dr. Murphy since 1991 and I trust him completely.  Every visit is made enjoyable not only by Dr. Murphy, but by the friendly staff.  From the moment I walk in I'm treated like an old friend by everyone, from the girls at the front desk, the dental assistants, the hygienists, and all the staff.

They take time to answer my questions, help me make decisions, and never have I felt rushed or ignored with my concerns.  They always make sure that all my needs are met.

Before going to this office, I was very afraid of dentists and dreaded going for my checkups, but not anymore.

< text>
If you're nervous about getting dental work, I understand. I was really nervous too. Thankfully, you can rest assured that you're in good hands at SLO Smiles. If you're scared, Sarah will take the time to call in a sedative to your pharmacist or ensure there will be nitrous oxide available for your appointment. If you then take this nitrious oxide and accidentally deflect Dr. Leopold's hand while he tries to inject novocaine in your mouth he'll be super patient with you. And if his hand happens to get pricked with that needle causing a massive hematoma, he'll still be really nice to you. < user>
115426445237181007890<//user>
< name>
Debra Sanchez</name>
<time>1512073699215< /time><rate>5<//rate>< review>
I went in for a dental cleaning July, 2017,  at Leopold Murphy and Main ( now SLO smiles) where  I met the hygienist, Robin B. She was very,  kind and explaiedn every procedure she was about to do! During my initial treatment it was suggested that I purchase and use a waterpik. I didn't believe in waterpiks and thought they were a waste of money but I thought that I would try it anyway. Robin B also gave me a plan to follow for better care of my gums. I followed the treatment plan and just left the office today ( Nov. 30th) and I must say we were both amazed! Where  I previously had 36 "bad spots",  that number had been reduced down to one. Previously,  I had beat leading gums when I flossed (Yuck) and today, one small spot! These results were amazing! Robin B is an amazing, empathetic hygienists who knows her job! She said I can come back and in 6 months instead of 3 because of the healing that has occured! Thanks to her plan, my gums are healthier and my smile is brighter! Thank you Robin B!</review>

<name>Thomas Horse LLC<//name>< Text>
Be wary folks, Just a big corp who will not work with you if you are unable to return equipment instantly, billing will continue Due to Covid I was unable to fly and assist my dying brother, he opted for hospice and unplugged the unit as it was calling all the time.  I tried to ask his cna‚Äôs to return the equipment without success.  I was finally am able to travel to assist my brother, during his last days.  Bay Medical runs your credit card, not for a final due, No their system is set to bill in each month separately, well my cc denied multiple similar charges from out of state like they do fraud cases.   Watch out the company systems are problematic, and will lock up your card, if it doesn‚Äôt process they will keep trying until your card is locked.  Pay only with a check.< /Text>

<name>Charissa Kaczorowski<//name><Date>1620147172420</Date>< Rate>
4< /Rate>
<review>Fairly straightforward to hook up and use. Found that base does not need to be hooked up next to phone, can use jack in any room. Also when  RANGE testing, just press the button on the lanyard every 5 seconds or so, not continually. Other than that, we had no issues. Good product that gives us lots of peace knowing our family member is safely monitored. Good and quick response.<//review><pictures>None< /pictures>< resp>
{'time': 1620146268120, 'text': "Hi Charissa - Thank you for your feedback and honest review. We advise when testing or even during an emergency to press the button only one time. It's best to press one time and the alarm will trigger on your base station and you will let the alarm continue as you would in an emergency. Once the live dispatcher connects over the base station 2-way speakers to check your status, simply let them know you are okay and just testing. We advise to do this test monthly.\n\nNow, if you are range testing, then yes, you will press every 5 seconds and listen for the beep. This is only to test the range distance between your button & the base station.\n\nIf you ever need help testing or range testing, we are always happy to help walk you through it and do a live test over the call with you. Your safety and comfort is our priority!\n\nBest regards,\nBay Alarm Medical"}<//resp>

< Text>
We wanted to give my ma (and us!) a little peace of mind living on her own after a very scary medical emergency. Bay offers many options to fit any need (she doesn't have a landline or cable). Thankfully she has not had to use it in an emergency but when calling to shuffle her emergency contact numbers, changing her address, accidentally setting her wearable lanyard button off while opening a jar of pickles (good one, ma), and testing her unit monthly (don't forget to do it!), I/we have always gotten someone stateside very quickly and they've just been wonderful. She has her main unit, her wearable button, and a button in the bathroom, all for a VERY reasonable price. I was a little overwhelmed when first looking but the choice was pretty clear. I've not regretted the decision one bit!<//Text>

<user_id>113551784181882131600<//user_id><name>Cathy Fassel</name>< date>
1615842745521<//date>
< rating>
4</rating>
<Text>My mother-in-law had an alert button with fall detection  with Bay Alarm for four years.  Fortunately, she did not have a fall that required attention.  She inadvertently set it off a few times, and the system worked and help was sent.  The only thing that concerned me was that when we dropped the button from shoulder height as a test, it sounded for help only twice out of 5 drops.  So, I'm not entirely confident that if she fell, it would alert for help if she was unconscious.  They told me that the results are different when the device is on the person who falls, but there is no way to test that, until a person falls and that's too late.  The employees have always been helpful and kind.  Consumer  Reports gives Bay Alarm high ratings which is one reason we chose them.<//Text><pics>None< /pics><response>{'time': 1615913563151, 'text': "Hi Cathy - Thank you for your honest feedback. We certainly understand your concerns as Fall Detection can be hard to test. With that being said, please remind your mother-in-law there is a button on the Fall Detection Pendant. If she falls and is still conscious and moving OR needs help for anything, as some emergencies don't include a fall, we highly recommend she press the button once. This should be her first option. The button will always work - the activation of the Fall Detection may not trigger if she falls and is still moving a lot (i.e. trying to get up) or if the fall didn't create a hard enough impact. Emergencies are hard to predict of course, so the Fall Detection gives her the security of both a button and the fall activation. We certainly want your family to be knowledgeable and aware of how it fully works, so please don't hesitate to ask any questions. You can always email us at support@bayalarmmedical.com Thank you!"}</response>< GmapID>

<Review>We had high hopes for Bay Alarm Medical for my elderly father as it came highly recommended, but when we actually required assistance for faulty equipment, Bay Alarm Medical did not help and did not even follow its own extensive and lengthy terms and conditions contract. We purchased the GPS plan, the fall detection plan, and a lockbox (recommended by them) along with the monthly insurance - everything we were told my father would need for a solid monitoring system based on his situation. Everything arrived within a week, but the lockbox did not work properly. After trying to open the lockbox for a while and then spending 20 plus minutes on the phone with the service department without success, my father was told to return the box and they would send a new one BUT he had to pay for shipping to return it AND pay for a new box and more shipping. (He would be reimbursed for the new box at a later date - minus all of the shipping charges.) As my father's account manager, I then called the service department and read the contract to the representative that stated new equipment would be sent to us at no cost, he informed me that he wasn't sure about that because this is how they handle returns. Fifty minutes of phone conversation solved nothing - which begs the question, if this is how effective they are replacing faulty equipment, how effective will they be monitoring the system? It certainly explains a lot of the lawyer-ease about how they cannot be held liable for basically anything in the contract. Bay Alarm Medical may have a decent operating system, however based on our own experience with what should have been a simple solution, we opted not to entrust my father's safety to them. We will look elsewhere.<//Review>< Time>

116961943464033338694<//UserId.>
<user_name>Tami< /user_name><Date>1608170563787<//Date><rate>4< /rate>< text>
I updated this review from 3 to 4 stars, with an explanation given at the end.

Getting set up with a Bay Alarm system was easy and the alert service was fine. The quality of the base station and alert button was good, and the system was easy to use. My mom never had to use her alert button for an emergency, but the system tests always worked and we got notices if the base station lost AC power, like if it'd been accidentally unplugged.

I did have problems when I needed to cancel mom's service. Bay Alarm sent me a cancellation form, which I promptly filled out and returned. Turns out they sent me the wrong form and the service did not get cancelled. But no one contacted me, and I didn't know until a few weeks later when I got an auto call saying that the base unit was not connected.

It took several phone calls with many transfers and VERY LONG hold times to finally get another form, which also turned out to be the wrong one. So I called them again and finally, I hope, got the correct form. Total time on the phone was nearly 2-1/2 hours.

The Customer Service reps were all very nice and did their best to help, but the company's record keeping, internal communication, and integrity regarding billing are lacking.

The first rep I talked to said he'd cancel the auto calls and restart the cancellation process, but then I got another auto call after that and learned that the service was not cancelled.

Another rep said they'd received the original form I sent, but then another said they did not receive it. Also I was told that my mom would not get a refund for the month that followed my original cancellation request, in spite of the fact that they had sent me the wrong form. I'll be watching to see if they charge her for this month as well.

**** Update ****
Bay Alarm Medical got back to me about this. Gjenes from Customer Care expressed his concern regarding my difficulties cancelling and also got the payment refunded for the month after the cancellation. My 91-year old mom was very pleased about this, and we appreciate the attention given to this issue.< /text>
< pictures>
None< /pictures>
< response>
{'time': 1606331863877, 'text': 'Hi Tami - We are so sorry to hear about this experience. Could you please email us the details at support@bayalarmmedical.com? We appreciate your review, kind words regarding our reps, and your honesty. We are happy to help and do the best we can to make things right! We will be looking out for your email!\n\nThank you,\nBay Alarm Medical'}< /response>

My father fell this morning and Bay Alarm did not come online and talk to him.  He waited on his kitchen floor with no help for over 30 minutes.  Bay Alarm finally did contact paramedics and they eventually did show up and helped my father off the floor.  He then called Bay Alarm and waited over 60 minutes to be connected finally with John at Bay Alarm.  John did work with my father to get the system tested and working apparently but I would call this a fail.  John, age 25,  was extremely knowledgeable and helpful and my father would give John a 5 star rating.  Thank you, John.  The whole purpose of having this system is to help a person who has fallen and can't get up on their own.  If my father had hurt himself badly during the fall, this would have been a very serious situation and he would have been left on the floor injured or possibly dying.  This cannot be a system that works some of the time.  Not happy with the outcome.</Text>
<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< Resp>
{'time': 1600802962916, 'text': "Hi Marc -\n\nFirst and foremost, we are sorry to hear about dad's recent fall. Please send him our well wishes. We did speak with John C. and checked your account as well as the alert signal. It looks like there was no voice connection over the speaker box at the time, so dad did not speak directly with a dispatcher, but the dispatcher received the emergency signal and followed proper protocol all the way through. Remember, even if we cannot hear the user, we will always treat the alert as an emergency. In this case, the alert was signaled and in less than 10 minutes, our dispatcher called for an ambulance. We cannot confirm how long the ambulance took to arrive at dad's home nor do we have control over that, but we are very appreciative that they arrived and were able to help dad. We definitely understand the fear and frustration during these scary moments. We see that John was able to run a successful test with dad and everything is working as it should be. We always recommend loved ones test the device at least once per month to ensure it is working on their end (see test instructions below).  Dad is more than welcome to give us a call so we can run that test with him  we'd be happy to help! We apologize for any frustration you and dad felt at the time and we will continue to make improvements where needed to give our customers a 5-star experience.\n\nProper test:\n1. Press your button one time\n2. Wait for it to connect to dispatcher just like you would in an emergency\n3. Let dispatcher know you are okay and it is just a test. < user>

< name>
TheJoanne42<//name>

1593188828238<//Time>
<Rating>5< /Rating>< review>
I did a lot of research before deciding to go with Bay Alarm Medical.  We've had my Mom's unit for almost a year now, and every time I need to deal with their customer service I am more confident that I made the right choice.

<Review>After an exhaustive research process to find the best in-home medical device for my 81 year old parents located in Bradenton FLA, I decided to go with BayAlarm Medical - believe me I researched extensively!
I was extremely pleased with the assistance I received from one of the supervisors there INGRID - she was fantastic.  We spent quite a bit of time on the phone to address all of my questions and concerns, as my parents are in FLA with no family close by.
Decided to go with the in-home system with pendant and 2 emergency wall buttons $24.95 / mo), as well as the AT&T 4G LTE ($10 more per month but don't have to worry about landline failure due to storms / outages), a very attractive snap on jewelry piece (4 of which to choose from) so it doesn't scream that my Mom is at risk of falling - looks like a very nice necklace and very lightweight, an extra pendant for my father, and a lockbox. And no contract to be locked into!

My main concern is whether the AT&T signal strength will be at least 2.5 down there because areas with large bodies of water tend to have decreased signal strength.  Hoping when I am down there next week that we can position it in a clear spot with strong signal - really hoping it all works out - but it not, I can return for full refund within 30 days. Ingrid gave me her direct number for any questions yesterday.

Another thing to be aware of is the technology in the Fall Detection  industry is not yet perfected and may cause an excessive amount of FALSE FALL readings - this applies to all of the companies who offer this - my fear was that after finally convincing my parents that they need a medical alert system, I thought they would get turned off by repeated false readings - for instance if they plopped down on a couch and system thinks it is a fall - and some annoying issues -  decided to wait on that option until it is much improved.  This system package should provide peace of mind for all of us until we figure out what needs to be done long-term.

Today I tried to order it online, but I was not able to request expedited shipping (only standard for $12 was available online - hope that gets improved)  - given COVID, weather, etc. all things have been delayed - wanted expedited but could only do that by calling in the order.

Well it was yet another pleasure to reach REGAN today - she was so helpful in getting everything set up quickly and again addressed all of my questions and got the order ready to go out tomorrow am and arrive by end of week even during the Christmas Rush!

Well, so far, very impressed with customer service, reviews, options, and the "pretty pendant my Mom chose" - will provide an update to this review once we set it all up with monitoring folks and test it out.  PEACE OF MIND FOR ALL FOR NOW!!!!!!!

Thank you Bay Alarm Medical for having such excellent people on your team like INGRID and REGAN - give them a raise for dealing with me - ha!< /Review>< Date>
1608487804506< /Date>

<user_id>104336251645771197628< /user_id><username>Don Robinette< /username>< date>
1591658405377<//date>
< rate>
5<//rate>
< text>
I ordered the Bay Alarm Medical devices for my 89 year old mother in March 2020. She lives alone but we have home health aides at various times during the day and thru the night,

On Sunday morning June 8, 2020 I received a call from Bay Alarm that the fall detection on my mother's necklace had activated. When they made contact with her she stated she was injured. Bay Alarm initiated the emergency call list and also called local EMS.

We also have a security camera in Mom's apartment to keep an eye on her when no one is there to make sure she is OK. After I hung up form the Bay Alarm operator, I checked the camera and she was indeed laying on the floor by the apartment door.

Fortunately my niece lives only two blocks from Mom and I am less than five minutes away so we got there very quickly. the EMS arrived just a few minutes before me and right after my niece arrived.

Mom suffered a fracture of the upper right humerus and will be in a sling for "many weeks".

The over-night aide had left at 7am, the next one was scheduled for noon. In reviewing footage from the camera Mom fell at 8:41am.

If not for Bay Alarm system our mother would have lain on the floor for over three hours in excruciating pain.

We are so thankful for extremely quick response of the Bay Alarm call center representative - he called within two minutes of mom falling.

I've already recommended your service to several friends who have elderly relatives living alone.

THANK YOU!!!!!

Sincerely,
Don Robinette
Ohio<//text>

None< /Pics>

< text>
I purchased this for my mother and assisted her in setting this up. A month ago it suddenly went off. A strange out-of-state number came on and since those are nearly always phishing calls - and they are many - I ignored it. But I quickly saw that voicemail was left and then knew it was from Bay Alarm.

I instantly made phone calls since I am two hours away. My mother was helped within 15 minutes. What a gift and help this is!

From what I understand from my mother she never pushed the button. It was the fall detection that went off.

I am very glad for this device. It was worth the cost. It is also very convenient and effective.

Mom is now moving into an Assisted Living facility as a result of her fall. She will no longer need this as it will be provided in that facility.

Many thanks and much appreciation for the great work you do!</text>

<user_name>Robert Bibow<//user_name><userid>116014938044209305888< /userid>< review>
I got this service for my mother because I saw great reviews online. But here is how it really works
Every time I try to call, I spend up to an hour on hold waiting for somebody to pick up the phone.
We have been trying to cancel the account for ages. We unplugged the equipment and mailed it off weeks ago. They can see it is unplugged, but they say until they have received the equipment, you have to keep on paying. Apparently there is no end date on that, so if they keep saying they have not received the equipment, we are stuck paying them forever, for a service we are obviously not using.
This is no way to run a business.</review>
<pics>None<//pics><Response>{'time': 1594058529010, 'text': 'Hi Robert - Thank you for your feedback. We apologize for any confusion and misunderstanding regarding our cancellation process. To clarify, the account remains active until we complete the cancellation process. Cancellation of the account is not when a customer unplugs the equipment. Because it is leased, we have to receive it back to our warehouse and complete the inspection. Please note, the process takes a bit longer due to COVID-19 guidelines, as we are taking extra precaution for the safety of our customers and staff. However, this does not mean you will be charged for the time it takes to process. Bay Alarm Medical always honor the postmarked date, so you will not be charged for anything based on tracking. For example, if your billing payment is July 1st and you return the equipment with a postmark date on or before July 1st, you will receive a refund for any auto charge that processed on July 1st. Again, we apologize for any confusion and frustration. We are happy to have clarified and hopefully that addresses your concerns. You will receive an email when your account is fully cancelled.\n\nAll the best,\nBay Alarm Medical'}</Response><rating>1< /rating>< GmapID>

I was scheduled to have surgery to remove a meningioma brain tumor and doctors told me there was a likelihood of having a seizure before surgery. I was not feeling well and was on my own during the day up till time of surgery and I thought a medical alert button would provide me and my family peace of mind. I researched and selected Bay Alarm Medical based on the reviews and the fact I could use only as long as needed, also cost was reasonable compared to other devices.  Surgery went well and I am now fully recovered and back to work.  With device no longer needed I had no problem canceling. <name>Beverly Dorrian< /name><Pictures>None</Pictures>< review>
I called in the evening to change my address. I waited for a long time and so I thought I would have better luck if I called in the morning hours. The same thing. They gave an option that they would call me back if I left my number. I don't like to do that because I don't know if I will be available when they call back. I finally got a representative to answer my call. He was very nice and I got my address changed in their system. He even had me push the help button so he could check to see if the change of address went through. After that he had me go to different rooms in the house to make sure I didn't have any dead spots and could alert from every room. He was very nice. It is just the waiting so long no matter what time you call. They need to hire more people.<//review>

<userid>100482102711991314946< /userid>< text>
Beware if your address changes and if you wish to cancel service.  To accomplish them you must call in  and you will hold and play phone tag for days.  Even though we gave them the address change over the phone, when I tried to cancel the service online almost a year later, I realized that they still had the old address.  It is as if the phone conversation changing the address never happened and they would have sent help to the wrong address.  You cannot cancel online so they have a chance to question your logic and caring of your loved one (scare tactics).  You must pay shipping to return the equipment and even though you have notified them by phone regarding the cancellation, they still send "severe past due notices" , causing anxiety for your senior loved one, and they still charge you for service until they receive the equipment...which they tell you takes two weeks after they actually receive equipment.  Don't trust a company that makes it so difficult to cancel service.  Check out BBB complaints.< /text>

We always call customers back during business hours. To cancel, customers simply give us a call for proper power down instructions and cancellation details. {'time': 1603823363384, 'text': 'Hi Jim - We are sincerely sorry to hear about your loss. We are very understanding at how difficult these times are and do our best to make the cancellation process simple. We do not charge any cancellation fees and only require the equipment back in working condition as it is leased. We are very transparent about these details on our website as well as the service agreement and at the time of order. Now, we do not want you to feel frustrated or upset and we are always happy to work with families as every situation is different. While we cannot stop billing and monitoring due to safety reasons, the representative kindly let you know we can refund the account once we receive the equipment back. There is no way to stop billing and pause the account or close the account while the leased equipment is still out. Again, we are more than happy to refund the account once the equipment is back to us. We deal with many families and different situations and we do our best to accommodate, especially during difficult times.\n\nThank you,\nBay Alarm Medical'}</Response>

< review>
I spent a lot of time researching medical alert companies.  I am so glad I decided to go with Bay Alert.  My aunt, who is now 90, was determined to live independently for as long as possible.  My three sisters and I were determined to support her, although she has very limited vision due to macular degeneration and severe hearing loss.  Her apartment is less than 5 minutes from my house, but I am a full time teacher.  Bay Alarm could not prevent her falls, but knowing that as soon as she pressed the button, someone was speaking with her, and contacting me.  I do not know the names of all the wonderful people who provided the warm, reassuring voice of help on the way, but each of you earns a star in your crown!  Because of you, I could sleep nights and teach days without a constant sense of anxiety.  You gave Bernice her independence because I had confidence that she was never 'alone'.  She has chosen to leave Texas and has moved into a wonderful assisted living apartment near her son in Ohio.  I do not have enough words to express my appreciation for all you have done for us these past years.</review>

< Review>
I ordered an alert system from bay alarm for my Mom.
It arrived as scheduled. My first system did not work,
I called that afternoon around 6 and had to leave a message.  It was returned the next day.
I returned to my Moms, called them back and after trying everything with them over the phone
They determined the system did not work.  They told me they would send another one out express mail.
It arrived 2 days later and worked right away.  I called them to help me set up the necklace part and extra help buttons.  They stayed on the phone with me and we got them up and running.
So I am very please so far-  the only reason I didn‚Äôt give the company 5 stars?  I think they should have a better answering machine message stating their hours.  It would have reassured me that they just weren‚Äôt engorging my call. If you call during their hours they are very helpful.< /Review>

<date>1564253316652</date>< Name>
Tara Maginnis< /Name>
< Text>
I got this Many months ago after my father had a fall.  It was easy to install, if anything a little twitchy (if the neck unit got bumped hard, or we had a blackout) it would go off and I'd be talking to somebody who would check in to know if we were having a problem.  I consider this a good thing, as the default was to check up on Dad.  The unit never had problems or went off for no reason, even with Dad wearing it night and day.  The service people were great on the phone, especially the guy who helped me uninstall it and pack it for sending back after Dad died. He explained how to power it down, when billing stopped, etc.  I'd highly recommend this service and device.< /Text>

<time>1588894813957< /time><pics>None</pics>< Review>
I got a full package for my dad last year--pendant, gps, home unit, which included the Caregiver Tracker app for my cell phone.  I hadn't followed up on the app, and realized I really needed it when my 90 year-old dad failed to answer the phone one night.  (Turns out his landline was dead and he couldn't hear his cell where it sat on the charger.). I talked to Jennifer at Bay Alarm Medical and she talked me through how to set up the app on my phone, which allows me to LOUDLY ring my dad's gps unit at any time of day or night to signal him to call me.  He knows if he doesn't call me, I'll be sending EMT's.  I was also able to register 3 other family members to do this, too. This feature is a huge comfort for me.  Cannot say enough about how patient and helpful Jennifer was.  Five stars!</Review>

< text>
Although my Mom just got the system I had sent her, she was pleased with tele-help she got setting it up.  I looked at reviews and Bay Alarm verified they had cell service in her area since she does not have a land line.  There was no pressure,  reasonable monthly rate, customizable options and answered many questions.
The only reason I have given Bay Alarm 4 stars is even though I set up account as payor and my mother as recipient, they sent her package to her address with MY name on it.  This review and communication was sent to my mom's name, so they need to to fix that.  They asked for who to bill and receive communication and who recipient is, and I gave correct info.  I am sure there are others setting up accounts for older family members and taking care of details.</text>

< Review>
After hours and hours of confusing research online looking for a medical alert system, we selected Bay Alarm Medical. Consumer Report was very helpful in comparing several systems, which helped simplify the hunt.
We have been clients now for four months and am impressed again and again.  The customer service and tech support is patient, clear, helpful and very pleasant to work with. We selected the In-Home system with fall detection and the GPS pendant system for away from home with fall detection.  We also added 2 wall "Help" buttons near the floor in the bathrooms.

We just moved the whole system to our summer home and updated our  address, contact list, and tested. Even when the alert goes off by accident, they are very patient and supportive.  When I, the wife, & installer, need help or advice, they are always there!  I particularly liked and still use the videos online - clear, not complicated, easy to follow & understand.  We both highly recommend the Bay Alarm Medical system.  The peace of mind for us both is so reassuring!</Review>

< Name>
Harvey Albert< /Name>
< Rating>
5</Rating>
<Review>Bows and curtsies to Bay Alarm Medical for  steering me on the straight and narrow road into why I needed a home system and the Mobile GPS system.  I see my conclusion was wrong.  Also, the back ordered item was received, well within the time frame expected.  Your company has earned all the accolades received and like all first class companies its not the problem, its how it gets corrected.  I look forward to a long positive relationship.
***********************************************************************
Quite frankly I am very disappointed with the way this my transaction started out.  I went with the favorable 5 star reviews as my determining factor to go with Bay Alarm Medical.  I ordered the Home/Mobile GPS device and upon receipt of the unit a flyer was enclosed saying the Mobile GPS device was on back order and should be back in stock "in less than 2 weeks".  In my case I should have in on or before April 8, 2019. I should of been notified at time of order of this back order situation.

After reading the enclosed documentation I couldn't justify why do I need the home unit when the Mobile GPS device is cellular and I always have at least 4 bars of cellular signal in my home.  I asked the question to customer service and they tell me that you may not have cellular service in your home therefore the home unit would be more reliable.  I assure the rep that there are places outside around town that do not have a cellular signal as well and I think Bay Medical may be overloading its customers with unnecessary equipment and more importantly expenses.  As a side note I was told that once you are home you should remove the cellular pendant and replace it with the home pendant.  Then if you leave again replace the home pendant with the cellular one.

Finally, I will not activate the system until I receive everything I ordered and at that time I will decide what I will do.<//Review><Pictures>None</Pictures><response>{'time': 1553703632114, 'text': "Hi Harvey - We sincerely apologize for the delay and miscommunication in your order as we experienced a back order in some of our popular products. We are happy to see that it looks like you will get the device by the end of the week. In regards to your concerns about Mobile GPS and the In-home system, we definitely do not overload our customers with unnecessary equipment. We would never want that as it wouldn't be good for the customer or our team if people had things they didn't need. The Mobile GPS is our on-the-go medical alert device, and while it can work in the home (depending on coverage),  the user will have to charge it and while its charging, they would not be covered with any sort of device. The In-home device does not need to be charged so, in your case, it can be used while the GPS is being charged. Depending on the customer's preference, people prefer to wear the small button rather than carrying the GPS around the house. As a reminder, the In-home button cannot be used during an emergency while you are away from home. Once you have everything, feel free to give us a call so we can help walk you through setting up and testing everything. Our Customer Service team would be happy to help! At that point you can then see how you feel about having both for in-home and away from home coverage. Thank you, Bay Alarm Medical"}<//response></record></dataset><record>

< review>
Bay alarm helped keep my father in law home for five years, giving us the security of knowing that when he fell he would be just minutes from getting the help he would need to get back on his feet again. On the occasions he actually needed to be looked at for further medical intervention, that help was also just a button click away. Bay alarm alerted me right after calling emergency medical personnel, so I was able to be there within minutes. The pendant he had worked up to 300 feet from the base unit, allowing him the freedom to be out in the yard and still covered. He had no internet and no interest in learning new technology, yet this system was perfect for him. I would definitely recommend!< /review>

< review>
My family arranged for Bay Alarm services after I returned from an unexpected hospital stay.

Fortunately, I never actually "needed" to the alarm but its presence has been a tremendous peace of mind to me and my concerned family.

The customer service people have been very gracious and helpful.

I am also impressed at the additional capabilities of my "command central" unit as it can be programmed to respond to other alerts, be set for reminder alerts (like taking prescriptions), and more.

It is my pleasure to recommend the Bay Alarm service to all people concerned about safety while living alone, or to those who want to help a loved one with a reliable safety check service.<//review>

< Review>
I had put my faith (and my health) into the hands of Bay Alarm, all day, routinely, wearing the emergency (button) unit around my neck. Luckily, never had to use it to summon help, so far. Nonetheless, on two occasions, I heard three "beeps" coming from the unit. When telephoning Bay Alarm (sometime later) to inquire into these beeps' meaning, was told "never heard this before; cannot explain; call us immediately next time this happens". It happened again yesterday, and I did call Bay Alarm within 30 minutes to report; received pretty much the same response: "don't know". So, what's up?

In the same phone call, reported the lack of response (during a test) to my pushing the Emergency (SOS) Button. Your instructions state "hold ... for 3 seconds or until you feel it vibrates". I did the former and had zero response. I was then told to hold until vibration, and, eventually, was connected. That could cause a problem in a real emergency! Waiting three seconds may all one is able to do, thus, one misses the alternate call approach. Should that be corrected in your instructions?

Finally, I reported and questioned the purpose of the red Power Status LED light coming on. I was referred to  your instructions, namely, that the light comes on at 40% battery capacity.  It is my habit to charge my unit EVERY NIGHT at bedtime for the entire night, in expectation of always having power throughout the ENTIRE FOLLOWING DAY. Here I was advised that excessive charging could cause the battery to fail, and that THREE HOURS OF DAILY CHARGING would be sufficient. There is no mention of this in any of your instructions! Besides, after three hours, I am usually asleep, and would miss taking the unit off its charger. How much of an issue is that?

Please clarify. Little details do matter!</Review>
< Rating>
3</Rating>

We are just at the starting gate. So far so good. Both tech support and the dispatchers were very courteous and thorough in helping us test the system and be sure everything is up and running.

This system is for my 95 year old Mother-in-law who lives by herself on her 5 acre property. I tested it out to the mailbox and over to the peonies where she regularly weeds. The range is great.

<UserId.>117767287955370298167< /UserId.><username>Nancy Barbata</username><time>1560686422830< /time><rate>5<//rate>< review>
Our mother wanted to live as independently as she could but we wanted to make sure she would receive help in our absence if she fell or injured herself. There are a lot of companies that offer med-alert technology but Bay Alarm Medical offered the features we wanted AND the friendly, helpful support on the phone we craved. Every time I called, the agent listened patiently to my questions and answered them thoughtfully. Once the pendant and "alert box" that sits on the counter arrived, I called Bay Alarm Medical to ask if they could walk us through what would happen when Mom pressed the button. The agent stayed on the line with me (I called from my mobile so Mom's home phoneline was open) and then walked us through an actual call with the response team. I would recommend Bay Alarm Medical to any family trying to sort out how to care for aging parents.< /review>

With a variety of styles I selected the necklace.  In and out of the shower, the call button is completely waterproof with a quick dry cord that does not feel like a damp tie around your neck.

The unit is designed for a sturdy fit on any furniture.  Small and compact yet

I explain I am testing and no other problems.  A very courteous agent determines call is resolved before the disconnect and reset.

Bay Alarm Medical works for me.<//text>

Have used Bay Alarm service for my elderly dad for over 2 years now.  He has worn the pendant and also had the manual alarm button to use with one touch. <gmapID>0x80856693b1eabe9d:0x64381fc120e1c2ef</gmapID>< userid>
115497401926475881175<//userid>
< Review>
I can think of twice in 18 months of service when my Mother's medical device literally saved her life. After my parents mobility declined my sister moved closer to their house so she could help with various tasks and assist in traveling to and from medical appointments. But we wanted a little more 24hr support without intruding on my parents' privacy. I did some research and based on several factors chose Bay Alarm.

The best example I can give of the service you can expect is, my parents have a gated driveway, but there is a service vehicle entrance to the right. After attempting to contact someone to open the gate and being unsuccessful, Bay Alarm informed the medical team of the entrance. Thankfully they were able to get to my mother's aide in time because of the readiness of Bay Alarm and the time they took to ensure they understood the lay of the land and what difficulties they might encounter.

The other time my mother recalled often was when she fell in the shower. We had the waterproof unit in the shower. When she fell she was able to press the button and Bay Alarm was able to contact my brother, who was just around the corner. No need for an ambulance, and my mother did not have to worry about being rescued by strangers ,naked in a bathtub.

Well worth every penny.< /Review>

< Review>
At approximately 4:25 this morning I was awakened to emergency vehicles in front of my house and in my driveway.  When I looked out to see if a neighbor had an emergency, I realized a fireman was coming to my door!  Before he could open the lock box for a house key, I opened the front door.  He asked if I had an emergency as they had been alerted by Bay Medical.  I assured him there was no emergency and I had not pushed my alarm bracelet or the HELP button by my bedside.  He confirmed that the green light was on, not red if it were an emergency.

After apologizing to them for the false alarm, I called Bay Medical to find out what happened.  Technical personnel would not be available for several hours so I called later in the morning.  They could offer no explanation for the false alarm or why I had not received a call from Bay asking if I had an emergency.

Gail Means< /Review>

<user>111935165289977449110<//user><Name>Thomas Humar</Name>< time>

<rating>2< /rating>< Review>
We had ordered this as a gift for my mother, a home monitoring service after a series of falls. We chose this service over others because of the website‚Äôs claims of ease of use and no contracts.  My mother and her boyfriend were NEVER able to get this system appropriately installed in her home, even after several people came in to assist with installation. Also I ( as the contact person for emergencies ) got repeated calls that a monthly test on her system was needed. This couldn‚Äôt be performed because it wasn‚Äôt functioning correctly, but even if it had been, I was not in possession of the device to do said test! After one year of hit and miss service, and multiple calls from my mother for assistance with this problem, she asked that I cancel her monitoring. I contacted Bay Medical and was told that if the equipment was not received by a certain date we would be charged for another year of monitoring to our card on file! This was not the original agreement and was, in fact, why we went with this company to begin with. We mailed our equipment back in the original box and it was received the day before we were to be billed ( confirmed by USPS tracking number). However, I was still charged the next day for another year of monitoring.
We were not impressed with either the service we received from this monitoring or with the overall experience as a whole. Hopefully ours was an isolated case and others will have better outcomes for such an important safety feature for their family member.
After our cancellation, a representative did contact me via email to ask how to improve service and request to discuss theses issues with me. I have been unable to reach out to her yet due to the holidays.<//Review>

< review>
Purchased this system for my mom when she began falling often. She is a parkinson's patient and had also began showing signs of dementia, I ordered the pendant with fall detection and its a good thing I did since she couldn't think to press the button on her wrist button. One day she fell 4 times in a 12 hour period, she was never injured, her falls were more of a slow motion slide or toppling but she couldn't get up on her own. Luckily the paramedics station was only a quarter mile away and were usually coming into moms house while i was on the phone with the bay alarm representative who always called to let me know when paramedics had been dispatched. This is an awesome service unfortunately my moms condition deteriorated so quickly that she has moved into a care facility but I highly recommend this system for anyone who is a fall risk.</review>

<Text>Most excellent service always.
My father was 91 and still living alone when he started falling down. One morning when I arrived at his home, I found my dad on the floor bleeding from the skin tears on his arms. He had been there several hours. Before help had arrived, I convinced him to try Bay Alarm Medical.
Every experience with Bay Alarm was a good one. From setting up the system, to customer support for testing, and most importantly the Emergency Responses.
Unfortunately, my father needed to use the emergency "push button" necklace on more than one occasion. He received prompt and professional care every time! The dispatcher called everyone on the call list each time there was an emergency. They followed the outlined procedures to perfection each time.
My father has now agreed to move to an assisted living home where he will no longer require Bay Alarm Medical's services. I recommend this company to everyone. Fantastic service for my loved one, PRICELESS! Thank you Bay Alarm Medical.</Text><Pictures>None</Pictures>< response>

<date>1556081595546<//date>< Rate>
5</Rate>
< Review>
All you really need is the wrist bracelet (and in-home help button device that comes with it). These devices work as intended.

The auto fall function on the necklace doesn't work properly. I doubt another company does auto fall detection better. It seems like an underdeveloped technology.

Bay Alarm's customer service is very good as long as you call (via phone or help button) or utilize chat via their website.

Only other complaint is that they don't turn off the auto reminder on their contract even after you respond via email asking them to do so. I never asked for a contract and they don't require one to be signed. Cancellation is easy. No fees as long as you return the equipment. UPS makes this easy. Bay Alarm is a trustworthy company.

* Edit in response to Bay Alarm's reply * The equipment was already returned and every bill paid.  The auto reminder is not for a bill. If you re-read above, I wrote that the auto reminder is for a contract that wasn't required prior to service beginning. I never requested the contract / auto reminder and it is still on. This is meant as constructive advice to help make your business better, because it is a good and important one.< /Review>
<pictures>None</pictures><Resp>{'time': 1555951546106, 'text': "Hi there! Thank you for your feedback. Everyone's needs are different but we are glad to hear the In-home system is working for you. Our team always continues to test products to help improve any and all experiences for our customers, so we appreciate your insight. In regards to the auto-reminder, we do not stop any billing until we receive the leased equipment back to our office in working condition. Any charges that occur during the time of shipment will be refunded along with unused time. We go based off of the postmarked date and are always happy to help if any issues arise. Again, we appreciate all your feedback! Thank you for taking the time to share it with us. Best regards, Bay Alarm Medical"}</Resp><gmap_id>0x80856693b1eabe9d:0x64381fc120e1c2ef< /gmap_id></record>

< Review>
A solid service for safety issue, but many problems on the billing side of the operation. My sister continues to receive overdue notices, despite having the account set up for auto-payments via credit card, as well as two phonecalls and email to the Billing Dept. Seems to be a systemic problem. I normally do not post negative reviews, but Bay Alarm sent me an email asking for a review after the multiple communications with them to get the billing straightened out -- then yet another erroneous overdue notice arrived, and this  a day after I received the email confirmation of the latest monthly payment. The left hand does not know what the right hand is doing. I though others should be aware of this weakness in the service. We have been frustrated by this for the last 3 months and are looking into changing service to another provided.<//Review>

<user_name>Sandi Conley< /user_name><Time>1468934876607< /Time><rating>5<//rating><review>Our family purchased Bay Alarm medical alert for our mother who is in her nineties.  We did a lot of research and I was so surprised by the huge difference in cost for the same service.  I called one place that wanted about $300 to come and set up your system and $98 a month after that!  It was the first place I called.  Thank goodness I found Bay Alarm!  Set up was simple.....took about 5 minutes and we were ready to go.  They even have a YouTube video showing how to set up.  We tested it, and it worked fine, except my mom couldn't hear the person very well.  I talked to the bay alarm person, and she did something that made her voice come in much clearer.  Then Mom could hear it better.
If your loved one can't hear the person or is unable to answer, they automatically send help.  We test the unit monthly, and we are satisified that it works the way it should.  They always know who is calling, have the address and repeat it to us.  Everyone I've ever talked to at Bay Alarm has been courteous and helpful.
It gives our family some peace of mind to know that Mom can get help if she needs it, and that we will be notified immediately.  Well worth the $25 a month!< /review><Pictures>None<//Pictures>< resp>

< UserId.>
104449346519230105555< /UserId.>
<name>Sarah Lawrence< /name><Date>1467040998626</Date><Rating>5</Rating>< Review>
I am the adult daughter of an amazing 98-year old.  Mother is independent, feisty, and refuses help at almost everything.  She still lives alone, drives, reads, knits sweaters, mows her lawn, cooks all her meals and does all her laundry.

However, after two tough falls (and 45-stitches) inside the house, and one bad fall outside, I told her that it was time to get a personal alarm.

We wanted a unit that she could use inside the house for physical falls or if someone tries to break in.  And I wanted a unit that she could use outside that would reach for several hundred feet from the base unit.

Bay Alarm Medical fit all our needs perfectly!  And she has been faithful in wearing the necklace at all times (it also came with a wrist band unit).

If she pushes the alarm, I love how there can be several calls made: first to me, then to 911, etc.  This is important so the fire department doesn't show up, if she inadvertently sets it off.

The clarity of the voices is great too, since she's hard of hearing.

So for me and my mother, the peace of mind, the clarity of reception, the responsiveness, and the price is worth its weight in gold!< /Review>

< Text>
I signed up with Bay Alarm Medical to protect my 83 year old mother from any accidents that might occur. She is widowed and lives alone in her house, possibly 30 to 40 minutes away from my apartment.  Her health is failing, and my two sisters and I worried about her constantly. I would frequently check the status of the Bay Alarm home system when I went to visit her. The customer service was always courteous, patient, and extremely efficient.
Three weeks ago my mother fell and was unable to stand up. My mother activate the alarm and Bay Alarm Medical quickly contacted an ambulance to be dispatched to her home. The technician then called me to let me know my mother had fallen. My mother later told me that she was amazed at how quickly the paramedics arrived at her door. She was taken to an emergency room to be treated. The professionalism and efficiency of Bay Alarm Medical's assistance was absolutely excellent. Their service provided was everything I had wanted it to be. I am very impressed with this company and I am extremely grateful for the protection they have provided for my mother. Cheers and thank you.
Duncan McDonald</Text>

< Text>
If you live alone and have an ongoing health issue, you should get this service.  They provide you with a pendant that you wear and you tell them where - outside - you have hidden a key to your house.;.  In a medical emergency, push the button on the pendant and it notifies this company, who in turn immediately calls an ambulance..  They tell the ambulance folks where key to your house is hidden so they can get in.   I once accidentally pushed the button on my pendant - without realizing it - and within minutes, an ambulance was at my door and two medics came running in, using the key I had hidden.  I apologized profusely - but at same time was impressed/relieved to see how well the service worked.  .Great company, great service.<//Text>

< Text>
This product works as advertised.  Any time our father pressed the button or fell the alert went out.  The only issue which isn't the products fault is that people advanced in years don't think to push the button.

< text>
The Bay Alarm Medical System is a wonderful investment! The service they offer allows me to move around freely without any worries of being alone. The lanyard they supply is also small and does not get in the way of my daily activities. The best part to consider, is that the button is waterproof! Taking it in the pool for my daily swim or the shower helps reassure me that help is only a push away. With my lanyard I am free to do anything I would like. The entire system was easy to install and the customer service agents at Bay Alarm Medical are always there to help. I would recommend Bay Alarm Medical to anyone looking for a life alert system with easy connection to your family incase of emergencies.</text>
