< gmap_id>
0x80856693b1eabe9d:0x64381fc120e1c2ef</gmap_id>
<Review>Do not use this company.  I got a necklace with fall detection for my mother who has had falling issues.  Last month she had a stroke when she was alone in a room and could not move or talk. Fortunately, my father randomly walked in the room and found her and had to call 911.  She is incredibly lucky to be alive after a procedure to remove a blood clot.  When I called Bay Medical Alarm and we tested the fall activation over the phone with them, we discovered the device was faulty and did not work.  I explained the situation and asked to be reimbursed for the 3 months we had the device and was told by multiple employees that they would only reimburse me the $10 per month for fall detection, but not the total amount per month.  After I pushed to speak with a supervisor, I was told I would get a call back from a customer service supervisor (after several calls) within 24 hours and instead it was another front line staff who called back and told me the same thing.

When I went in person and we tested the new necklace they would replace it with, the alarm de-activated after the necklace was slightly moved.  I asked if this is typical and they told me that if the person falls and the alarm is set off, it will de-activate if they move at all (this makes it completely ineffective).  I explained that I was never told this when I ordered it.  The billing supervisor (Rebecca) told me that this had all be explained to my sister when she picked it up and that they had offered to test the necklace before she took it home, but she declined.  I called my sister and she said both of these things were lies.  When I shared my mother's story with Rebecca in person, she said that they would not give me the full refund because since only the fall detection was faulty, my mom "could have pushed the button".  I can't believe anyone would be insensitive enough to say such a thing after I just explained that my mother almost died and couldn't talk or move after she fell!!! Finally, after several more phone calls, I reached the customer service supervisor who agreed to fully refund us for the 3 months.  Unbelievably upsetting experience!< /Review>< Pics>
None< /Pics>

<Name>Paul Lyon</Name>< Date>
1544209430324</Date>
<Rating>5< /Rating>< Text>
Excellent service.  Arranged this for my mother who ended up with 'drop foot' following back surgery and thus had to use a walker from then on. Her biggest fear was falling, naturally. I live in another state, so did some research and chose Bay Alarm Medical service for her safety and my peace of mind.  My mother had a couple falls where the service definitely got her aid ASAP and would stay in contact with her via the two-way In-Home device until help arrived.  BAM would call down the phone-tree of contacts we provided, leave a message if there was no answer, and continue calling down the list until they reached someone. She had a few false alarms from accidentally pressing the pendant button from leaning forward at her computer desk. In those instances she would be totally embarrassed, but the BAM staff were considerate, polite, and never shamed her for it. My mother is moving into an assisted living facility so we are cancelling the service now, but we never had a single complaint in the 3+ years she had the service. Highly recommend Bay Alarm Medical.</Text>

<userid>107760529170549545240</userid><name>Nathan L Jones< /name><time>1456860914155</time><Rating>1<//Rating>< Text>
Bay Alarm medical has policies which promote unfair treatment of senior citizens, due to unfair requirements for return of medical equipment which she was unable to use and inflexibility with returns.My mother purchased the Bay alarm medical alert device and upon getting it set up, realized that it does not work for her. She found the bracelets to be cumbersome and difficult to take on and off, which she was required to do regularly after taking a shower. She did not want to wear the necklace because it was uncomfortable her for as well. As soon as she realized this, she had me call Bay medical alarm to explain that she was going to be returning and make sure that she would receive her money back.*(I am serving as her representative because the logistics of calling and making complaints would be too hard on her right now). I was explained by numerous representatives and managers that there was no way that she could receive her money back and that the policy of 14 days starts upon current receiving the package, which at that point was over. I explained to the managers that because my mother is elderly, it took her a while to remember to open the package and get it set up and also that from the day that it was actually activated, we were within the 14 day period of that day. They would not budge at all. I explained that the product was not working out for her and asked for some leniency, based on the fact that she is a senior citizen and that we were only a couple of days after the grace period for return and well within the 14 days of activation. The managers were supposed to call my mother to fix the issue, but they never did. I had to call repeatedly to follow up and whenever I was told that they would not make an exception for my mother, they refused to give me the name of someone else to call who was higher up on the managerial chain. I feel that this is very unfair to not work with my mother on this issue and feel this is taking advantage of senior citizens. I worked with both the BBB and our local consumer affairs and no one was able to get through to them that they are committing elder abuse so hopefully they will read this review, modify their policies to be more accommodating to seniors and prevent this from happening in the future.< /Text>

While I explained to the representative that their website said it would be shipped the day of the order (if placed by 2:00) he was not helpful in that regard and said he could not do anything.  Due to the fact the alarm had not been sent out at the time  I was speaking with them on the phone, and because the expedited service was no longer needed since I would not get it in time to take it to my relative the following weekend, I told him to cancel the expedited service and to send it regular delivery.  Again, remember this is before product had even been processed to be shipped out that day, which was already two days later than promised.  Notwithstanding that, the representative refused to adjust the shipping time and/or refund me the additional expedited shipping cost I had paid. that it was on its way, that they've had computer problems and so on. When I spoke with Alex, one of the supervisors on February 23rd and was told it would take another month. I also paid for 6 months of activation. Not happy will probably return the unit and go with another company.

< Review>
Their cancellation and return policy needs work. The service was fine, even though we never utilized it. However, they fail to tell you once you cancel you must have the equipment back to them before the bill date. They still charge you for the service while they process your return which can take up to two weeks. Meanwhile they refuse to issue a refund while it's being processed. Also, I was paying quartley and they refused to change to it to monthly so that I was only charged for one month of service instead of three while they process my return. Take this into consideration before cancelling and returning their product.< /Review>

It was not made clear by Bay Alarm that they would be calling in the event of an emergency from a phone number different than their regular number toll-free number.  So, at 2am my phone rang from an unknown number in Utah.  Thinking it was telemarking, I didn‚Äôt answer.  Turns out my grandmother who has the alert service was having chest pains and the paramedics were called.  They also called one other person on her emergency contact list, but did not leave a voicemail, and skipped calling the 2 other people on her emergency list.  Anyway, later that morning I got the voicemail they left and called back to ask where the paramedics took my grandmother, and they said the local authorities would not release that information due to the HIPAA act.  Really?!? Thankfully we have one main hospital near us, and they confirmed she was admitted.  I don‚Äôt know if this is a serious flaw in the HIPAA laws, or with this company, but it IS obvious to me that the person at Bay who took the 2am call was completely inept, and we suspect asleep when the call went through, since my grandmother said they acted and sounded like that, and even put her on hold at one point, so she was listening to on-hold music while having chest pains...  very reassuring Bay Medical!< /Review>

< Text>
Set up was very simple although I had one small glitch. My base unit was sending the "help" signal but we couldn't hear each other talk. Bay did the right thing by calling 911 and then my phone, but they were able to stop the 911 visit when the problem came to light (one day it will be funny). The tech and service personnel are very helpful and professional.  The only complaint I have is the difficulty in getting the wristband on.  I have very small wrists and finally had to cut inches off the band to get it to work at all.  It's still very difficult to get on and fastened with one hand. Seems like a simple Velcro band would be a much better solution, especially with arthritic hands.< /Text>

I thought that this was a good idea. I encouraged my Dad who is in his 90's to get it. I wanted to like this company based on reviews and pricing, but after reading the contract in detail, I am not able to.  READ THE CONTRACT!  Paragraph #4 states that "WE MAKE NO REPRESENTATION OR WARRANTY AS TO THE PROMPTNESS OF THE CENTER'S RESPONSE TO A SIGNAL" and later it states "WE MAY BE NEGLIGENT IN PROVIDING THE SERVICE , AND MAY FAIL TO PROPERLY RESPOND TO THE REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE" - what are we hiring them for if they can't warranty that they will be in fact promptly responding to an alert signal!  I would be hiring them for one thing - Personal Emergency Response System" and that is was they call their system and they can't guarantee they will do it!  Makes absolutely no sense.</review>
<rating>1</rating><Response>{'time': 1507827475827, 'text': 'Hi Peggy ‚Äì Thank you for taking the time to express your feedback and concerns. We definitely understand your frustration, especially because you are doing your best to protect your loved one. In regards to our terms and services, it would be irresponsible on our part to promise 100% guarantee promptness, when our UL-Certified U.S. based dispatchers contact your local 911 personnel and cannot control the promptness of your local 911 personnel, as well as possible situations out of our control such as connection issues due to service towers, phone lines, power, etc. that could affect the promptness to respond to a signal. These are standard business practices for the medical alert industry, we understand it can be overwhelming, but as a family-owned company that has been around for over 70 years, we can guarantee that we will provide the best training to all of our employees in order for them to do their best when assisting your loved ones. Whether you decide to go with Bay Alarm Medical or another medical alert company, what is most important to us is that your loved ones stay protected. <name>Susie H</name><Time>1474068343196</Time><Rate>5</Rate>< Review>
I must say that I was skeptical about this program at first because there have been so many scammers calling my Mother's home peddling this type of product claiming that she won it, or a caring family member ordered one for her. That type of telephone activity gave me a bad taste in my mouth so I wasn't sure who to trust. With that being said, I knew with my elderly diabetic Mother living alone that I needed to do something to help deal with the high risk of her falling when she is alone. I did my homework, I decided on Bay Alarm and boy am I glad I did. It was money well spent. She collapsed one night due to low blood sugar and fortunately she was wearing her pendant. When the dispatch center tried to make contact with her to see if she was alright and she didn't respond they sent the paramedics. This one act very likely saved her life because her blood sugar was so low she could have gone into a diabetic coma. The paramedics were able to get her to a hospital and get her stabilized and she came back home that same night. THANK YOU  BAY ALARM! It is money well spent for sure!<//Review>

<text>It was awful!!!  Mom fell and because she tried to get up, the alarm was canceled.  I was led to believe that if she fell, you would call.  I found out today that it was not true.  While she wasn't injured badly, she was very scared.  Luckily, I had gone over on my own.  Otherwise, she would have been laying there for a long time, NO THANKS TO YOU!!!!  Will be looking for another company as soon as I can do the research.  Your policy should be IF YOU FALL, WE WILL CALL!!!!  Not turn off the alarm!!  What if she had broken a bone?  She could have been moving in agony and you would have ignored that.  NOT SATISFIED AT ALL!!!</text><Pics>None<//Pics>< Response>
{'time': 1554746337279, 'text': "Hi John & Peggy Moore - First and foremost, we are so sorry to hear about mom's fall and we understand how scary and stressful it is for her and the family. We are glad to hear she did not suffer from any injuries. Although the fall detection is built in to detect falls, it does come with a push button for loved ones to push in an emergency if they fall or get hurt in any way that doesn't cause them to go unconscious. Sudden movement after impact on the button will cancel out the call because it is treated as a false alarm - if it didn't, there would be numerous false alarms throughout the day with every single movement. We never advise anyone to attempt to move and get up after a fall and always encourage loved ones to push the button or stay put and it will signal a fall and set the alarm off. We are terribly sorry that happened to mom and your family and are happy to address any further concerns or questions to better assist you. Thank you."}<//Response>

<Name>Art Remnet<//Name><Date>1406137178980</Date><rating>2< /rating>< review>
The service provide by Bay Alarm and the responsiveness is very good.

BE WARNED: All of their contracts are auto-renew and there is no courtesy reminder or notice prior to renewal. And Bay Alarm has a strict NO REFUND policy, regardless what the you speak with has to say.

So if there's a chance that you won't want the system renewed, cancel before your renewal date or you will be paying for a year of service that you won't use.

Just another way of staying in business I guess - stick it to the customer.</review>

Reading through some of the other reviews it seems to be a common practice to charge people even after they're deceased.  I called them to notify them of my mother's death and stop the service but was told that until the equipment is returned that they would continue to bill us.  I thought naturally there would be some grace period to return the equipment; even big cable companies give you that benefit, however,  was told no there is no grace period provided to return the equipment.  I tried to explain that her family won't be able to do this for a couple of weeks given the distance that we live from where the equipment is but was told that didn't matter we would be charged until it was returned irrespective of whether anyone was using the service. <review>I looked at services for my 80 year old mother who had both knees replaced. They paid a year in advance and used the service while she recovered. They received a 3-4 page contract in small print which was signed and returned. They had no more use for the service. Upon there paid in advance anniversary there credit card was charged for another year, that same day i called to say the service was not needed and could they refund the charge. I was told no they don't do refunds and to cancel they had to return the equipment which they will do. ANYONE CONSIDERING USING BAY ALARM BEWARE OF THIS AS MOST 80 YEAR OLDS GO ON TRUST. THEY USED THE SERVICE AND PAID FOR IT, HAVE NO MORE USE AND WILL NOT BE REFUNDED THERE $263.00 DOLLARS. ANOTHER COMPANY TAKING ADVANTAGE OF THE ELDERLY. It's been so reassuring to both my grandmother and me to have her safe when she's alone, since she wanted her independence and didn't want to move yet.  I was worried, so I researched companies and decided Bay Alarm Medical was the best choice.  Shas used her button about five times.  Each time the company has been extremely responsive.  She has recently had more trouble.  She couldn't get out of her chair, so she hadn't eaten all day.  She finally pushed the button.  The EMTs came and helped her right away, using the info we provided to find the hidden house key. Then they helped her, fixed her some food, and even picked up a few groceries.   Now we are moving her in with my aunt.  Because of this service my grandmother was able to extend her independence, and they kept her safe.  I'm so thankful that this service exists, and I gave five stars because she really felt safe with the responsiveness of the company.<//Text>

< Text>
I am extremely dissatisfied with the service for this company. I will never recommend this company to anyone in my community needing a medical alert. I truly believe I was cheated out of my money. When I received the medical devices, there were several false alarms, which woke my grandma up in the middle of the night. This prompted me to end services. < text>
I carry the device all the time. This makes my family relax and not be concerned when I take long walks alone. I feel secure. I have never needed to push the alarm.

I find the cord around my neck bothersome. It chaffs so I don't wear it. I keep it by my bed. I think the bracelet looks bulky. I have never used it.

You informed me one night that my land line was not working. I think it was around l: 00 a,,m I checked all my phones which were as they were supposed to be. Charter was informed by you and soon my land line was working. I would not have received this quick attention if I had called so I appreciate your service. Karlan Strong< /text>

{'time': 1509639591196, 'text': 'Hi Ann - Thank you for taking the time to review us. We are glad to hear the experience went well and we sure hope your loved one is safe. We advise caregivers to take caution in regards to unknown numbers as it may be us, but if you choose to ignore the call our dispatch center will leave a voicemail. < review>
Handicapped and needed alarm unit prior to my wife's leaving town January 7.  Called in order Dec26 and was repeatedly assured I'd receive it in a week.  On dec28 received UPS email it would arrive jan7.  I called BAM and was told the holidays slowed everything down.  Why didn't my dec26 contact know that?  Had to pay for expedited shipping to receive in time.
Contact list had to be hand-written on their form and mailed in, instead of completed online.  (Yes, my handwriting is legible.)  Phoned in a single contact to customer support while form on the way.  BAM did allow me to scan and email the form to them.
Directions for testing the unit said to go to far parts of home and press the pendant help button but to hit the reset on the base within 5 seconds.  (Impossible for me to traverse that distance in 5s!!)  Customer service said i could do the "range test" instead but no directions for that came with the device.<//review>

<Review>I was a little hesitant about going with a company other than the heavily-advertised one that most people seem to know about, but the cost savings were significant and everything I saw looked like it was a good choice for my mother.  More than anything else, she wanted to know that the first alert would go to friends, not to 911, and this promised that.
It proved to be an excellent choice.  95% of the times her alert button got pressed (maybe three times a year over the four years we had the system) it was by mistake, but in each situation the reassuring voice confirmed the mistake and made sure she was well.  Once she apparently pressed it by mistake as she left the house, but a neighbor was able to go check and confirm that she was not hurt.  And then, one day she fell getting into bed and couldn't get up.  She pressed the button and within minutes the friend next door was there helping her get back into bed.  No drama--just the help she needed when she needed it.  Exactly what we were paying for.</Review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< response>
None</response>

I called customer service, the walked me through what I needed to do and had me test both the pendent and the GPS which worked beautifully.  They knew who I was and my location.  I live alone on a farm and have been concerned about having an animal (sheep, pig, or donkey) knock me down and not be able to call for help.  Hopefully I will never need it. <user_id>107651117430063918328<//user_id>< user_name>
Carolyn Scheel Shepherd</user_name>
<Date>1468696551037< /Date><rating>4<//rating>< Text>
I've had Bay Alarm Medical for about a month now. I am 57 with cerebral palsy and subject to falls and I live with my 90-year-old mother. We've had to call the Fire Department several times because when I fall out of my wheelchair I cannot get up. The Fire Department suggested getting a medical alert button because one night I was on the floor for five hours before my cries were heard. After much research I chose Bay Alarm. We chose a wrist bracelet instead of the necklace to wear. My mother has been perfectly comfortable with her wrist alarm. I, however, since I use my arms so much with my wheelchair found that I was accidentally setting off the alarm repeatedly. They were very kind about it each time. Their first concern that we each were okay. They never got annoyed at a false alarm. But I switched to a necklace, because I was annoyed by triggering the false alarms. I had to pay extra to switch to the necklace, since the free trial period is only 14 days. But it took the full month to realize that no matter how I wore the bracelet---on which arm, facing up or down--I was still going to trigger the alarm. Other than my triggering the alarm by accident, we have had no problems. And the false alarms have proven to us that they will be there if we ever do have an emergency.   The price is reasonable. We did not opt for any of extra services.</Text>

< Rate>
1< /Rate>
<Review>Terrible experience using the equipment for the first time.   He pushed the button for assistance, the call appeared to be answered and he pressed nine to confirm. This happened twice. Still no EMS arrival after 11 minutes so my father called me and  I called the dispatch center who had no record of his request for assistance at all. The dispatch center in off hours was completely not helpful,  and were unable to troubleshoot the problem. They told me to leave a voicemail for tech-support for the next day. Also, it turns out the Bay Medical protocol does not require the dispatcher to stay on the line with the patient until EMS arrives. The patient must request it. I find that appalling.  It took more than 30 minutes to get him the medical care he needed which is completely unacceptable. Thank goodness he wasn't having a stroke or heart attack.   I'm glad I found out about this poor service on an occasion when it was not a life-threatening emergency. Thank goodness for that.  I will be getting a different monitoring  system for him tomorrow morning.

Now that I have read many more reviews, I am very disheartened that I could have such a terrible interaction and so many others couldn't wait to thank Carlos or Tricia for their customer service.  I'm sorry but way too many reviews appear to be fake.  I wish I had read further to read REAL reviews.  Those are actually meaningful and bad.  No company has such transparently fake reviews as Bay Medical.  The "Owner" comments always show concern about a low star rating.  At best you are offered a rep who will contact you in 24-48 hrs.  I never read an owner comment that acknowledged a problem or promised resolution. Just that someone would call.

What a fool I wax not to see through the bulls**t  reviews.  My bad.

DONT USE THIS COMPANY.  YOU WILL BE SORRY....<//Review><pictures>None< /pictures>< response>
None<//response>

< review>
I am newly enrolled in the Bay Alarm medical alarm system. I have  had a recent occasion to make use of the emergency services offered. I had a bad fall in my condominium apartment in Lee, MA.  I could not get up and was in bad  pain. Fortunately I was wearing the alarm necklace  and pressed the button.  I received a call to confirm my need for help. The response was really quick with police and an ambulance with paramedicals who took me to the local hospital emergency service. I am most appreciative of the Bay Alarm service and their prompt and effective response.< /review>

< text>
Bay Alarm Medical does not miss a thing in re: to their service on behalf of my 93 year old mother.  The ONLY  reason I did not give 5 Stars is because there needs to be a better explanation for family members of their Bay Alarm Medical client of what can happen under various circumstances.

Such as:
1.  The client presses their button and is not aware that they did so.
2.  The client has a new Base Station (for whatever the reason) and the BAM has not updated the change until BAM hasn't received a "ping" from the original station.  This triggers an alert via email, thus, a family member needs to call to inquire, straighten things out.

Again,  I am VERY satisfied with Bay Alarm Medical.  I live in a different state than my mother.  She has felt much better with this service while we work out details to get her closer to us.<//text>

I hooked up the unit and was unable to plug the unit into the phone. < Review>
*ATTENTION*
CHECK SUBMITTED COMPLAINTS ON THE BETTER BUSINESS BUREAU BEFORE DECIDING TO DO BUSINESS WITH Bay Alarm Medical. They may have a good overall rating but they PREY ON MEEK CONSUMERS!

I had a medical monitoring contract through B.A.M. for two years and have no complaints about the  actual monitoring service.

The problem was encountered in their handling of the returned monitoring station unit.

They kept the UPS-packed, properly returned, non-tampered with unit for about three months then sent me a invoice for $150 stating that the unit was tampered with.

I never tampered with the unit and FILED A COMPLAINT with the Better Business Bureau and the charge was rightfully reversed.

*DO NOT ENGAGE IN BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY*

The monitoring service is adequate BUT, similar to what they did to me, THEY MAY TRY TO FIND A WAY TO GET MORE MONEY FROM YOU TOO< /Review>

<Review>My mother was 88 years old and had just broken her hip when she was visiting my sister. She lives alone and wants to keep her current living arraignments.  It was very obvious she needed a medical alarm system.  After reviewing several companies and different reviews, I selected Bay Alarm Medical. She now is approaching her 91st birthday and still lives alone in her home of over 68 years. Thankfully, she had not needed to activate the alert for a medical emergency; however, she as accidently pushed the alarm button a several occasions.  She loves the Bay Alarm, she says the operators call her immediately, are very courteous, and really appears concerned about her welfare.  Living over 400 miles away, this means more to me that you can imagine.<//Review>< pics>

<text>The service it's self has been really good.  So I feel bad rating it low, but I am unhappy with the customer service and feel it is important for other out of town family members to understand that even if your loved one is taken into hospital or hospice care long term, you have to return all the equipment immediately to be able to cancel the account.  At least let me suspend the service so I have time to drive the 500 miles to ship back the equipment.  I was disappointed at the complete lack of feeling on the other end of the line.  That said, Bay Alarm was helpful when my grandpa did fall and need help.  Customer service is what left a bad taste in my mouth and would make me consider a different service for my other grandparents in the future.  Bay Alarm is not the only game in town.  I recommend they improve their customer service for the existing clients to keep them coming back and recommending them to others.<//text></record></dataset><record>

<Text>Be careful when discontinuing service with these folks because they will continue to charge you until they receive their equipment back. Since she had a home care provider I did not see an further need for the unit. So being the one paying the bill on this account I sent them a letter cancelling service. Needless to say I received a 10 day notice letter from them. < Text>
This is one company that you do not want service from.  I am dealing with the accounts collection department right now and getting past Kevin Smith to speak with someone about how they treated my business partner and myself is equivalent to calling the white house and asking to speak to President Obama.  Their contracts are written to screw its end user (business) out of thousands of dollars even if their company picks the equipment up.  I will never recommend this company but if you choose services from them remember several things.

1.  Purchase the equipment and go on a month-to-month agreement.
2.  If the sales person is very pushy escort him/her out.
3.  Do not lease there surveillance equipment.  You can find dozens of companies that will install the same equipment for much less.
4.  Call other alarm companies and mention bay alarm lease agreements and you will hear hundreds of rip-off stories.
5.  Do Not Lease because that's how they stick you with the BS in their contract.  There is nothing special about their equipment.  Do not let the salesperson fool you.

Beware Bay Was Not Good For My Businesses.<//Text>

<user>103130083449859710030</user><name>Pj H.< /name><Time>1466725734354< /Time><rating>4<//rating><text>We chose Bay Alarm based on good reviews online and opted for the landline version because I was afraid the cell version would be left on the charger in a moment of need.  However you have to be within yelling distance of the unit to talk to the operator, so they cannot hear you if you are are another floor, or in the bathroom with the door closed.  (Bay Alarm is  supposed to call 911 if they do not get a response.)  Fortunately we have not had a need to use it in an emergency yet.  I watched videos on the Bay Alarm site showing people talking into the pendant, but I guess that is the cell/mobile version, not the landline version that we got.   My mom fell and fractured her pelvis, and after that she actually *wanted* an alert, so we didn't have to fight about it.   She wanted as small a pendant as possible, so we didn't get the fall alert.  She wears it under her clothes and seems okay with it.  The first time we called to test it, it didn't seem to work.  The second time they answered after a few rings.  They say you need to pay $200 if there is damage to the unit, or you can buy their damage insurance.  So you may want to get a surge protector for the phone and electricity for the unit (if you can still find one that takes phone lines) and forego the insurance, or not.  Hope this helps you decide!<//text>< Pics>
None<//Pics>

<GmapID>0x80856693b1eabe9d:0x64381fc120e1c2ef< /GmapID>< user_name>
Ron Epstein<//user_name>
< userid>
105282730214816425029</userid>
<resp>None<//resp>< Rate>
1</Rate>
<Date>1529212781186< /Date><review>When I first looked into getting a medical pendant for my Mother who suffers from congestive heart failure, I read many reviews on the different companies out there.   Bay Medical came up not as the top recommended company, but somewhere in the middle.  I think what attracted me the most about their product was that the price was a little cheaper than other companies.

Well, you get what you pay for!

My initial interaction with this company was through their website.  I ordered their equipment, it arrived in a little over a week's time.  Missing from the box was what should have been an extra phone cord so you could piggy-back the dialing/speaker unit to your phone.  Instead, the company provided a computer cable which was worthless for me -- and I suspect -- most other people's purposes.

After a few days, I decided I did not want to be charged monthly.  It would be easier to be charged quarterly.  I sent the company an email, they told me to call them on a specific day to change my billing so that I would not end up getting pro-rated.

On the specified day, I made my first phone call to the company and found out something rather alarming....

They don't answer the phone.

During regular business hours, no matter whether you need technical support, have a billing question, or you want to make an inquiry on becoming a customer --- THERE IS NO LIVE CUSTOMER SUPPORT.

Each and every time I called their customer hotline, I reached a recording telling me to leave a message.

l would leave a message and end up having to play phone tag with the customer service agents.  They call you back on their available time.  I spent days trying to chase down an agent over the phone until I finally gave up and told them to cancel my account and arrange to return my equipment.

At that point, they stopped emailing me back.  They would not confirm my cancellation request.  They became absolutely silent.

I ended up having to contact my credit card company and have the charge removed and a block put on all future charges made to me by Bay Medical Alarm.

Then I went to the BBB website and started reading one horror story after another about how uncaring this company is when tragedies do happen.  I suggest anyone thinking of dealing with this company do a check on BBB ratings.  Simply Google: "Bay Medical Alarm Complaints" or "Bay Medical Alarm Better Business Bureau".

I am now in the process of returning their equipment, at my own expense..  They won't pay for the return.

Do yourself a huge favor and spend a little more money with a more reputable company.  Any company that runs a Medical Emergency Business by forcing you to communicate through voice messaging instead of a live agent does not deserve your consideration.

UPDATE:  Went with LifeFone.  A little more expensive but they offer live customer support and their equipment is far, far better than what Bay Alarm Medical offered.< /review>< Pictures>
None</Pictures>
</record>
</dataset><record>
